description: The agency plans to take over the site as the Trump administration runs out of room to put arrested migrants.
title: ICE Eyes Massive California Tent Facility Amid Space Constraints

description: China stands to gain from the ongoing trade wars between the US and its allies, the European Union’s foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas said in an interview with Bloomberg Television.
title: China is ‘Laughing’ at US Trade Wars, EU Top Diplomat Says

description: The US is tightening sanctions on Russia by restricting payments for energy even as it pursues peace negotiations with President Vladimir Putin’s government over the war in Ukraine.
title: US Quietly Tightens Russia Sanctions as It Seeks Ceasefire Deal

description: Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer dropped his threat to block a Republican spending bill, opening the way to avoid a US government shutdown.
title: Schumer Says He Won’t Block GOP Bill to Avert US Shutdown

description: President Donald Trump and key Senate Republicans are still grasping for a solution to the US closing in on the debt ceiling following a White House meeting Thursday.
title: Trump and Senate Republicans Fail to Solve US Debt Ceiling Problem

description: Donald Trump’s choice for ambassador to Canada affirmed that country’s status as a sovereign nation and hinted the president’s complex relationship with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau might have played a role in his calls to annex it into the US.
title: Trump’s Nominee for Ambassador to Canada Agrees It’s a Sovereign Nation

description: British officials have held private talks with their US counterparts in an attempt to resolve concerns that the UK is trying to force Apple Inc. to build a backdoor into Americans’ encrypted data, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: UK, US Hold Private Talks in Bid to Calm Apple Encryption Feud

description: Democratic Representative Raul Grijalva, a leading progressive voice in Congress since 2003, has died at 77.
title: Arizona Congressman Raul Grijalva Dies After Battle With Cancer

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson looks at the standoff over government spending. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Senate Standoff Brings Government Back to the Brink of a Shutdown

description: The head of President Donald Trump’s government efficiency effort, Elon Musk, is emerging as a messaging punching bag for Democrats as they pick up the pieces of their stinging defeat in last year’s elections and search for a winning message for 2026.
title: House Democrats Try to Attack Trump by Targeting Elon Musk

description: Bill Pulte was confirmed as director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency after a majority of the Senate backed him to lead an agency that plays a key role in the US housing market through its oversight of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.
title: Pulte Confirmed to Lead FHFA Amid Questions Over Fannie’s Future

description: Portugal will face an early election on May 18, its third in just three years, after parliament toppled Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s center-right minority government in a confidence vote.
title: Portugal to Hold Snap Election on May 18 After Government Ousted

description: Mark Carney is making plans to visit France and the UK just days after he’s sworn in as Canada’s prime minister, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Canada’s New Prime Minister Carney Plots Visit to France, UK

description: France’s central bank chief slammed Donald Trump’s policies as a “tragedy” for the world’s largest economy, ramping up criticism of the US president as his trade war engulfs Europe.
title: Bank of France Chief Says Trump Economic Policy Is a ‘Tragedy’

description: The European Union is nearing an agreement to extend sanctions on individual Russians, including a number of billionaires, after Hungary dropped its opposition.
title: EU Poised to Back Extension of Sanctions on Russian Tycoons

description: President Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to let him partially enforce his executive order seeking to restrict automatic birthright citizenship, pulling the court into his drive to upend a longstanding constitutional rule.
title: Trump Turns to Supreme Court on Birthright Citizenship Curbs

description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum criticized a decision by a Supreme Court panel to block a justice from hearing a case related to high-profile tax claims against billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego.
title: Sheinbaum Blasts Ruling After Court Sides With Billionaire on Tax Case

description: Brookfield Asset Management Inc. is taking Peru to arbitration, alleging Peru has illegally expropriated a series of toll roads it operates in its capital city.
title: Brookfield Files $2.7 Billion Arbitration Against Peru Over Toll Roads

description: Elon Musk made an unannounced visit to the National Security Agency on Wednesday, a week after saying the secretive office responsible for foreign-intelligence collection needed to be revamped.
title: Elon Musk Makes Unannounced Visit to Secretive US Spy Agency

description: Germany’s top court rejected a suit brought by the populist left-wing party BSW seeking a recount of the votes cast in last month’s national election.
title: German Top Court Rebuffs BSW Bid for Recount of Election Votes

description: More than half of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s cabinet have urged his chancellor, Rachel Reeves, to rethink her plans to scale back welfare and spending, in an extraordinary sign of growing concern within the governing Labour Party over the scale of looming cuts.
title: Over Half of UK Cabinet Urges Reeves to Rethink Spending Cuts

description: Bulgaria’s government has a razor-thin majority after a court-mandated recount of October’s election results added another party to an already fragmented parliament.
title: Bulgarian Government’s Majority Is Razor-Thin After Vote Recount

description: Russian and European officials say the US is exploring ways to work with energy giant Gazprom PJSC on global projects, a step toward forging closer ties with the Kremlin while trying to broker a peace deal on Ukraine.
title: Russian and European Officials See US Interest in Gazprom Ties

description: Major US trading partners have offered a range of responses to President Donald Trump’s 25% tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, which took effect Wednesday. Most opted against immediate retaliation and many sounded ready to talk instead. Others took a more confrontational approach.
title: Hit Back or Hunker Down? The Dilemma of Responding to US Tariffs

description: Nigerian lawmakers rejected changes to consumption and company taxes that were proposed by President Bola Tinubu, dealing a blow to his efforts to bolster government revenue.
title: Nigerian Lawmakers Reject Changes to Consumption, Company Taxes

description: President Donald Trump said he would meet with New York Governor Kathy Hochul on Friday to discuss plans for an energy pipeline, among other topics.
title: Trump to Host New York’s Hochul at White House to Discuss Pipeline

description: The Senate Banking Committee advanced landmark stablecoin legislation Thursday in a major victory for the ascendant cryptocurrency industry, despite strong objections from top Democrat Elizabeth Warren.
title: Landmark Stablecoin Bill Advances in Senate Banking Committee

description: A San Francisco federal judge ordered the Trump administration to rehire thousands of the government’s newest employees who were terminated in February.
title: Six Federal Agencies Must Rehire Thousands of Fired Workers, Judge Orders

description: European gas futures dropped as much as 4.5% after President Vladimir Putin said a potential energy cooperation deal between Moscow and Washington could boost Russian gas flows to Europe.
title: Europe Gas Plunges After Putin Says US Deal May Revive Flows

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said he wants to discuss a proposed ceasefire in Ukraine with US counterpart Donald Trump, though he warned that any truce should lead to a long-term resolution of the war.
title: Putin Says He Wants to Talk to Trump on US Truce Plan in Ukraine

description: The activists were from the Jewish Voice for Peace.
title: Police Arrest 98 Protesters Demonstrating at Trump Tower Over Columbia Activist's Arrest

description: Scott Sheffield, the shale pioneer who sold his company to Exxon Mobil Corp. and was banned from its board by the US Federal Trade Commission, said he’s considering asking the regulator to rescind a ban on him being part of the oil major’s board.
title: Pioneer Founder Considers Asking FTC to Rescind Exxon Board Ban

description: Senate Democrats continued a standoff Thursday with Republicans over Elon Musk’s DOGE cuts as the US government approached a Saturday shutdown.
title: Democrats in Standoff With GOP as US Shutdown Deadline Nears

description: It’s taken less than two months since President Donald Trump assumed office and released a torrent of orders targeting elite higher education for universities to make clear they’re shifting course.
title: Harvard, Yale, Columbia Fall in Line After Trump Funding Threats

description: A southern African bloc is ending a joint military deployment to eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, where its troops had been supporting the army in its fight against rebels backed by neighboring Rwanda.
title: Southern African Bloc Ends Congo Deployment With Troops Stranded

description: The chief prosecutor investigating allegations of bribery involving Huawei Technologies Co. Ltd. has ordered two offices in the European Parliament belonging to assistants to be sealed off.
title: Belgium Targets EU Parliamentary Staff in Huawei Probe

description: The message is blunt, flashing on TV screens, streaming platforms and social media feeds across the country: Leave now, or we will find you.
title: Trump Turns to Self-Deportation Campaign as Mass Raids Falter

description: Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency now has 10 staffers at the Social Security Administration as the Trump White House looks for evidence to support its claim that there could be millions of dead people receiving public benefits.
title: DOGE Has 10 Staffers at Social Security in Hunt for Dead People

description: The Group of Seven faces the prospect of failing to agree to a joint statement again, even after the draft of the communique was significantly watered down, said people familiar with the matter.
title: US Objections Mean G-7 Faces Prospect of No Joint Statement, Again

description: President Donald Trump’s suggestion that the US government take over a depopulated Gaza Strip and turn it into a holiday resort was met with alarm in neighboring Arab countries.
title: Gaza’s Future: How Trump’s ‘Riviera’ and the Arab Plan Cross Red Lines

description: The resignation of a top US Food and Drug Administration lawyer helped convince Republican Senator Josh Hawley of Missouri, a member of a key US Senate panel, to advance the nomination of FDA commissioner nominee Marty Makary, he said at a Thursday hearing.
title: FDA Lawyer’s Exit Convinced Senator to Advance Director Nominee

description: A group of Democratic senators led by Elizabeth Warren is calling for an ethics investigation into a White House event promoting Tesla Inc.
title: Warren Calls for Ethics Probe Into Tesla White House Event

description: President Donald Trump was sued by a group of mostly Democratic-led states over his alleged plan to effectively dismantle the US Education Department by slashing its workforce by half.
title: States Sue Trump for ‘Dismantling’ of Education Department

description: The US on Friday will resume deportation flights to Venezuela that its government had halted after President Donald Trump’s decision to revoke Chevron Corp.’s license to operate in the country, an American official said.
title: Venezuela Deportation Flights to Restart on Friday, US Says

description: Friedrich Merz faced attacks over his credibility as the prospective German chancellor seeks to fast-track hundreds of billions of euros in spending.
title: Merz Defends Germany’s Spending Plan as Crunch Vote Approaches

description: Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof convened an emergency meeting Thursday with the leaders of the coalition parties as they split over the European Union’s latest defense spending proposals.
title: Dutch Coalition Parties Meet Amid Rift Over Defense Spending

description: The European Union and South Africa are holding their first summit since 2018, the latest step toward shoring up a shaky relationship in a world where both are currently the target of US President Donald Trump’s capricious politics.
title: EU, South Africa Hold First Summit Since 2018 as US Ties Unravel

description: Marcelo Rodriguez is in the middle of a chain of lending that has connected Wall Street to New York’s Spanish-speaking community, providing a lifeline to vulnerable borrowers including the undocumented. That lifeline is now starting to fray.
title: Deportation Push Sows Hidden Risks in Wall Street’s Debt Machine

description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana may have to make changes to the national budget after parties that control more than half the seats in parliament rejected his plans to raise taxes.
title: South Africa Weighs Budget Changes as Parties Reject Tax Hikes

description: It may take more than ten years for European NATO members to bolster their defense sectors, as the continent rushes to reverse decades of underinvestment and deter future threats from Russia, according to a Bloomberg Intelligence analysis.
title: Rearming Europe May Take More Than Decade, Analysts Say

description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick praised the UK and Mexico for refraining from engaging in tit-for-tat tariff hikes with the US, warning that those trading partners that upset President Donald Trump with their responses to American protectionist steps open themselves to a severe reaction.
title: Lutnick Praises UK and Mexico, Blasts Canada on Trade Retaliation

description: Five House Republicans urged Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell to take steps to improve liquidity in the Treasury securities market, including considering “targeted” changes to bank capital requirements.
title: Republicans Urge Fed to Alter Supplementary Leverage Ratio

description: Canada’s biggest auto parts names are buckling under the weight of US President Donald Trump’s tariff threats as the chances the North American car manufacturing industry will stall grow. That’s sending stock prices hurtling back down toward levels last seen during the Covid-19 pandemic.
title: Canadian Auto Parts Stocks Thrown Into a Tailspin by Tariff Woes

description: President Donald Trump threatened to enact a 200% tariff on European wine, champagne and other alcoholic beverages, the latest escalation in a brewing trade war between the US and the EU.
title: Trump Vows 200% Tariff on EU Wine, Escalating Trade Tensions

description: Regional forces who’ve been fighting alongside government troops in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo will be withdrawn, the Southern African Development Community said.
title: Southern African Forces to Withdraw From East Congo, SADC Says

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he’s scrapping NHS England, the arms-length body that oversees the bulk of the UK’s public health care system, as he sought to give ministers greater control over £200 billion ($259 billion) of annual government spending.
title: Starmer Scraps NHS England, Seeking Greater Control of Health

description: State Street Corp. will remain custodian of a 46 billion-franc ($52 billion) Swiss pension hoard after lawmakers rejected a bid to reassert domestic control as a guard against US strong-arming of the country.
title: Swiss Keep State Street for Pensions, Dismissing Trump Fears

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez is scheduled to meet the leaders of nine parties on Thursday as he tries to muster political support to boost the country’s defense spending and meet NATO targets.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Seeks Backing to Reach NATO’s Spending Target

description: The Reichstag building that houses the Bundestag.
title: Germany Debates Spending Push of at Least €500 Billion of New Spending

description: For years, Canadians from southern Ontario have made the short drive across the border to Buffalo, New York, to load up on cheap milk and shop at retailers like Target and Trader Joe’s that they don’t have access to at home.
title: New York Shopping Trips by Canadians Dwindle Over Trump’s Taunts

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump’s Rough Diplomacy Helps Erdoğan Pitch EU on Turkey

description: Iran will only enter direct talks with the US when both countries are on an equal footing and the Trump administration stops its “pressure and threats” on the Islamic Republic, a top Iranian official said.
title: Iran’s Top Envoy Says Direct US Talks Must Be on ‘Equal Footing’

description: The Trump administration’s push to drastically shrink the federal government shifts to a new gear Thursday, when agencies face a deadline to submit plans for large-scale layoffs and budget cuts.
title: Federal Worker Layoffs Climb Toward 250,000 as Deadline Looms

description: History tells us that tax cuts are more likely to lead to perverse results when they favor one kind of income over another.
title: How Trump’s ‘No Tax on Tips’ Could Backfire for the Working Class

description: Russian forces have been swiftly advancing in the Kursk border region ahead of talks with the US on Thursday, bringing President Vladimir Putin a step closer to his goal of completely dislodging Ukrainian troops from his country.
title: Russian Troops Advance in Kursk Region Ahead of US Envoy’s Visit

description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te said the government will work to let military tribunals operate in peacetime and announced a tightening of rules governing exchanges with China, underscoring growing concerns about Beijing’s operations on the island and in its armed forces.
title: Taiwan Works to Restore Military Trials Over China Influence

description: An Indonesian official declined to comment on news reports that President Prabowo Subianto is preparing another cabinet reshuffle that may include Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati, saying only it was his right to do so if he chooses.
title: Indonesia Official Stays Mum Amid Speculation of Cabinet Shakeup

description: Vietnam is stepping up inspections of particular children’s toys over concerns that imagery on the model’s face resembles a map China uses to stake competing territorial claims in the South China Sea.
title: Vietnam Probes Child Toys Depicting China Claim in Disputed Sea

description: Turkey wants closer cooperation with Europe in return for security as the continent looks at ways to reduce reliance on Trump’s America.
title: Erdogan Tries to Leverage Turkey’s NATO Muscle as US Retreats

description: Prospective chancellor’s legacy already hangs in the balance as spending push gets underway.
title: Germany Readies to Finally Lead Europe, If Merz Can Pull It Off

description: South Africa’s finance minister said he’ll enlist support from a range of political parties to get his revamped budget approved if the second-largest member of the nation’s ruling coalition follows through on a threat to reject it.
title: South African Minister Seeks Budget Support as Coalition Frays

description: South Korea is ramping up security to deal with potentially violent protests as it prepares for a ruling by the Constitutional Court on whether to permanently dismiss impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol.
title: South Korea to Barricade Court, Create No-Fly Zone for Yoon Verdict

description: Ozempic-maker Novo Nordisk A/S is planning to make more of its medicines for the US market in the country; Boeing Co. risks a gummed up supply chain and higher aircraft costs it may not be able to pass on; Chinese online retailer Shein Group Ltd. is offering incentives to its top apparel providers to set up new production capacity in Vietnam.
title: Trump’s $1.4 Trillion Tariff Threat Spurs Companies to Seek Cover

description: The US Department of Education’s sweeping cuts Tuesday included staff that oversee schools’ efforts to help millions of students learn English.
title: Education Cuts Include Staff Managing English Learning Program

description: London is expected to record the largest drop in house prices in the UK in the near term, according to property agents, as the capital is disproportionately hit by economic uncertainty and higher taxes.
title: London to Suffer UK’s Worst Drop in House Prices, Surveyors Predict

description: Vietnam’s top trade official is heading to the US in a bid to persuade President Donald Trump’s team that Hanoi is serious about resetting trade ties, to avert tariffs that could rattle its export-driven economy.
title: Vietnam Chases US Deals as Top Official Flies to Meet Trump Team
